newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Foreigners snap up core blue chips in Seoul bourse.
newsitem.headline: Foreigners snap up core blue chips in Seoul bourse.

text.p: Foreign investors bought heavily shares in 27 South Korean companies early on Friday, the first day of the latest increase in the foreign ownership ceiling, an official at the Korea Stock Exchange said.
The official said no new shares remained available for foreign investors of sought-after core blue chips including Samsung Electronics, SK Telecom, POSCO and Kookmin Bank.
Also selling out were Sungmi Telecom and Sam-A Aluminium, which are not considered blue chips.
The foreign stock ownership was raised to 23 percent on Friday from previous 20 percent. The ceiling was last raised in October.
But blue chip share prices remained lower as domestic institutional investors, accumulating the stocks ahead of the ceiling rise, sold into the newly created foreign demand.
